TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TaskOutputStorage extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents persistent storage for the outputs of an Azure Batch task.
Docs.remarks: Task outputs refer to output data logically associated with a specific task, rather than the job as a whole. For example, in a movie rendering job, if a task rendered a single frame, that frame would be a task output. Logs and other diagnostic information such as intermediate files may also be persisted as task outputs (see for a way to categorise these so that clients can distinguish between the main output and auxiliary data).

MemberSignature.Value: public TaskOutputStorage (Uri jobOutputContainerUri, string taskId);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Uri jobOutputContainerUri, string taskId) cil managed

Docs.param: The URL in Azure storage of the blob container to use for outputs associated with this job. This URL must contain a SAS (Shared Access Signature) granting access to the container, or the container must be public.
The id of the Azure Batch task.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from a task id and a URL representing the job output container.
Docs.remarks: The container must already exist; the TaskOutputStorage class does not create it for you.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task SaveAsync (Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Conventions.Files.TaskOutputKind kind, string relativePath, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken = null);

Docs.param: A representing the category under which to store this file, for example or .
The path of the file to save, relative to the current directory. If the file is in a subdirectory of the current directory, the relative path will be preserved in blob storage.
A for controlling the lifetime of the asynchronous operation.
Docs.summary: Saves the specified file to persistent storage.
Docs.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.
Docs.remarks: If the file is outside the current directory, traversals up the directory tree are removed. For example, a of "..\ProcessEnv.cmd" would be treated as "ProcessEnv.cmd" for the purposes of creating a blob name.
Docs.exception: The argument is an absolute path, or is empty.

Docs.summary: Saves the specified file to persistent storage.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task<Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Conventions.Files.ITrackedSaveOperation> SaveTrackedAsync (string relativePath);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Conventions.Files.ITrackedSaveOperation> SaveTrackedAsync(string relativePath) cil managed

Docs.param: The path of the file to save, relative to the current directory. If the file is in a subdirectory of the current directory, the relative path will be preserved in blob storage.
Docs.summary: Saves the specified file to persistent storage as a , and tracks subsequent appends to the file and appends them to the persistent copy too.
Docs.returns: An which will save a file to blob storage and will periodically flush file appends to the blob until disposed. When disposed, all remaining appends are flushed to blob storage, and further tracking of file appends is stopped.

remarks.para: Tracking supports only appends. That is, while a file is being tracked, any data added at the end is appended to the persistent storage. Changes to data that has already been uploaded will not be reflected to the persistent store. This method is therefore intended for use only with files such as (non-rotating) log files where data is only added at the end of the file. If the entire contents of a file can change, use and call it periodically or after each change.

If the file is outside the current directory, traversals up the directory tree are removed. For example, a of "..\ProcessEnv.cmd" would be treated as "ProcessEnv.cmd" for the purposes of creating a blob name.

Docs.exception: The argument is an absolute path, or is empty.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task<Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Conventions.Files.ITrackedSaveOperation> SaveTrackedAsync (Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Conventions.Files.TaskOutputKind kind, string sourcePath, string destinationRelativePath, TimeSpan flushInterval);

The interval at which to flush appends to persistent storage.
Docs.summary: Saves the specified file to persistent storage, and tracks subsequent appends to the file and appends them to the persistent copy too.
Docs.returns: An which will save a file to blob storage and will periodically flush file appends to the blob until disposed. When disposed, all remaining appends are flushed to blob storage, and further tracking of file appends is stopped.

remarks.para: Tracking supports only appends. That is, while a file is being tracked, any data added at the end is appended to the persistent storage. Changes to data that has already been uploaded will not be reflected to the persistent store. This method is therefore intended for use only with files such as (non-rotating) log files where data is only added at the end of the file. If the entire contents of a file can change, use and call it periodically or after each change.
